newsitem.title: ITALY: Fires destroy forests in Italy, arson suspected.
newsitem.headline: Fires destroy forests in Italy, arson suspected.

text.p: A series of fires that destroyed forests in Italy have been contained and three shepherds arrested on suspicion of arson in one of the blazes, officials said on Saturday.

Firefighters worked round the clock to douse blazes in the hills above the picturesque Amalfi coast south of Naples as well as on the nearby volcano Mount Vesuvius and in the Abruzzi mountains east of Rome, civil protection officials said.
They said they suspected arson in each of the fires, which consumed about 100 hectares (250 acres) of forests in both the Abruzzi and above the Amalfi coast.
The flames toppled large rocks onto the scenic coast's winding cliffside highway last Tuesday, forcing police to close briefly a section of the road between the resort town of Amalfi and Salerno.

Paramilitary carabinieri police said they had arrested three Amalfi-area shepherds on suspicion of arson, saying their motive may have been to obtain grazing land for their sheep by destroying the forests.
